intro: Eleocharis monantha, commonly known as the common spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or moist soils, often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. The plant has slender, cylindrical stems that bear small, spike-like inflorescences composed of numerous tiny flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into three-angled berries. Eleocharis monantha is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species.
